description: T:MARINE SCI

Undergraduate Corequisites: (CASEE144)required only for all Marine Science majors registering for CAS ES 144 . - Supports CAS EE 144. Examines the physical, geological, chemical, and biological processes that govern oceans. Emphasis on dynamic nature of the oceans on a short- and a long-term scale. This course is required for Marine Science majors registering for CAS EE 144.
T:MARINE SCI
Undergraduate Prerequisites: sophomore standing. - UNDERGR MAR RES

Undergraduate Prerequisites: sophomore standing. - Research in marine science for students at the sophomore level. Students design and implement a research project with a faculty member. Topic must be defined by time of registration. Course grade determined by performance and written report.
T:MARINE SCI
Undergraduate Prerequisites: junior or senior standing. - UNDERGRD MR RES

Undergraduate Prerequisites: junior or senior standing. - Research in marine science for students at the junior or senior level. Students design and implement a research project with a faculty member. Topic must be defined by time of registration. Course grade determined by performance and written report.
Undergraduate Prerequisites: junior or senior standing. - UNDERGRD MR RES
T:MARINE SCI
SR INDEP WORK

full_title: Senior Independent Work in Marine Science
description: Undergraduate prerequisites: First Year Writing Seminar (e.g., WR 100 or WR 120) - Laboratory or field research projects chosen under supervision of a Marine Science associated faculty member. Research topic must be defined at time of registration. Course grade determined by laboratory performance, written report, and oral presentation to the faculty. Successful completion of the full 8-credit course (MR 401/402) may lead to a degree with honors in the major; credit does not count toward major or minor (unless taken during Marine Semester). Effective Spring 2024, this course fulfills a single unit in the following BU HUB area: Writing-Intensive Course.

Undergraduate prerequisites: First Year Writing Seminar (e.g., WR 100 or WR 120) - Laboratory or field research projects chosen under supervision of a Marine Science associated faculty member. Research topic must be defined at time of registration. Course grade determined by laboratory performance, written report, and oral presentation to the faculty. Successful completion of the full 8-credit course (MR 401/402) may lead to a degree with honors in the major; credit does not count toward major or minor (unless taken during Marine Semester). Effective Spring 2024, this course fulfills a single unit in the following BU HUB area: Writing-Intensive Course.
Undergraduate Prerequisites: junior or senior standing. - UNDERGR MAR RES

Undergraduate Prerequisites: junior or senior standing. - Research in marine science for students at the junior or senior level. Students design and implement a research project with a faculty member. Topic must be defined by time of registration. Course grade determined by performance and written report.
Examines contemporary topics in marine sciences. Pre-requisites vary with topic. Offered as part of the Marine Semester. May be repeated for credit as topics change.

full_title: Marine Science Policy, Resource Management, and Public Debate
description: Undergraduate Prerequisites: enrollment in the Marine Semester. - This course addresses how scientists can target their research toward policy needs and then effectively communicate to the public and policy makers so that science might inform public policy. Taught during the Marine Semester.

Undergraduate Prerequisites: (CASBI260) and admission to the Marine Semester. - Examines ecology and management of commercially valuable fishes and shellfishes in the Belizean Barrier Reef with emphasis on human impacts on species diversity and abundance. Topics include population dynamics, essential fish habitat, bioeconomics, sustainable harvesting and management institutions.

full_title: Scientific Diving and Underwater Research Methods
description: Undergraduate Prerequisites: enrollment in the Marine Semester, basic scuba diving certification, and consent of instructor. - Introduces students to underwater research methods. Lecture and dive exercises include diving physics, diving physiology, dive planning, equipment, first aid, and data collection. This course fulfills American Academy of Underwater Sciences scientific diver training requirements. Taught in the Marine Semester.

full_title: Scientific Diving and Underwater Research Methods
description: Undergraduate Prerequisites: enrollment in the Marine Semester, basic scuba diving certification, and consent of instructor. - Prereq: Open Water certification plus six additional logged dives within the last year, medical approval, swim test, pool checkout, and consent of instructor. Introduces students to underwater research methods. Lecture and dive exercises include diving physics, diving physiology, dive planning, equipment, first aid, and data collection. This course fulfills American Academy of Underwater Sciences scientific diver training requirements. Contact instructor at narineh@bu.edu for more information and to request permission to register.
